Articles.Content: Assuming KSP gets the necessary patches for it to run long enough to play it, and save files for more than a day, are there any plans for DLC? The PC mods are amazing, and while I'm sure the consoles could in no way handle that same mass, could we still a few specialty items like fancy antennas, solar panels, command pods, science experiments, and craft containers?

As far as I know the answer to that is harsh but rather simple: No.
But SQUAD has a reputation of making very sudden and very weird decisions so you might get lucky some day. Who knows there will be console mods in the future. However you should not be surprised if it never happens.

On the other hand KSP is still in development. New features and parts are added with nearly every new update.

Edited September 10, 2016 by Tex_NL

Sony just announced a few days ago that they'll be blocking Bethesda from distributing mods for Playstation versions of their games (Elder Scroll, Fallout, etc).

Frankly: if a giant like Bethesda can't change Sony's mind, Squad certainly won't be able to. Don't ever expect to see mods for KSP on Playstation.

Now, on the Xbox, there may be a chance. It depends largely on Microsoft.
